ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.quest1.descrip: &dI'm going to beat the modpack author to death&r how am I meant to continuously automate so many of these in parallel
Instead of a &6Hint&r this would be a generalized setup that can be adapted towards any recipe using the apothecary:
1) You really should only have &bone apothecary per recipe&r. While you can do many recipes in one the &cthroughput on all items becomes lower and ensuring it doesnt choke becomes a lot harder.&r

2) A very simple (&bamount of droppers&r = &6amount of items&r + &athe seed/catalyst item&r) &d((as an example, the &epure daisy&d is &64 petals&d + &a1 seed&d so you'd put &b5 droppers&d above the apothecary))&r in a tower above the apothecary would very easily do the job. It's not very elegant but it will do the craft
3) Attaching &bcomparators&r to the dispensers and wiring them up to some kind of &btimer&r can ensure the set up doesnt try to craft if any component is missing from the craft
ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.quest1.title: Large Scale Apothecaric Automation
ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.quest2.task_41: And don't forget the living rock!
ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.quest2.title: Infused like an anime protagonist
ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.quest3.descrip: You need &eTHINGS&r and you need them in &e"YES"&r quantities!
&bR&relish in your beautiful creation pumping out the goods
&bY&rawn in your boredom and cave into the &6desire for the next thing&r
These things tend to be &eVERY COMPLEX&r with &eMANY STEPS&r
How on earth am &cI&r meant to deal with this?
&bF&rigure out the &6immediate next thing&r you are able to make given current production
&bA&rutomate said product in a way that will let you &6retrofit it in future&r or &6scale in parallel&r
&bC&ronnect the set up to the wider arcitecture of your system and &6modulate when that unit should turn on&r
&bT&rerminate the thought in your mind that this output is complex, as the &6system is doing it for you now&r, push onto the next task!
&bO&rrganize your systems! A spaghetti mess is fine early on but makes tacking on new systems very messy and &6slows down your ability to add more&r
ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.quest3.title: Think F.A.C.T.O.R.Y.
ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.quest4.descrip: &cWith every passing moment the monumental amount that must be achieved is dwarfed by the swelling of the next moment
&cI should take every oportunity possible to &bscale&c as much as is possible
ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.quest4.title: &cIdle hands lets the task expand
ftbquests.chapter.6tier_1.title: &6Тир 1
ftbquests.chapter.chemical_hell__opa_121: Hydrogen will be primarily produced as a &e&lbyproduct&r&r from other lines.
Direct production can be achieved through &aplatinum-catalyzed ammonium splitting&r.
Hydrogen is used &b&lextensively&r&r so be sure to beef up production and collection management infrastructure.
Oxygen is &c&lsurprisingly difficult&r&r to isolate without cryogenic-capable infrastructure or refined platinum-group catalysts.
Initial sourcing will look at removing oxygen from &6&lmetal-oxides&r&r as simple heat will liberate the oxygen.
Best renewable routs will involve stones generated from the &b&lMarimorphosis&r&r but alternative routs do exist.
Chlorine will be &aalmost exclusively&r sourced from regular ol' &6&lsalt&r&r.
A few select ores such as &bCorderoite, Mimetite, Chlorargyrite, and Pyromorphite&r gain chlorine as a byproduct yield once you unlock &lore-extraction sintering&r.
An odour of bleach and acid in your lungs
Similarly to oxygen, nitrogen suffers from similar &c&lpurification issues&r&r without cryogenic distillation technology
Sourcing initially will be almost exclusively as a &e&lbyproduct&r&r from direct hydrogen production
Production of &6Hydrogen Iodide&r is capable of producing a mostly pure stream of nitrogen gas. Albeit a &orather expensive&r way to source nitrogen
This Is Bromine, No Wait That Was Soy Sauce
You'll Make A LOT Of This
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest1.descri: This line of quests will guide you towards major key steps in increasing yields in gemstone-type processing
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest10.descr: An easy to smelt variant prised by the ancient greeks. Of course with your industrial machinery that just means less sharpening of your milling equipment.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest100.desc: A nickel sulfide mineral. Forms as thin almost furr-like crystals within rocks associated with pyrite
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest101.desc: A nickel arsenide. Has small quantities of cobalt, and sometimes antimony
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest102.desc: Mostly found in iron meteorites as an alloy
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest103.desc: Yet another iron-nickel alloy found in iron meteorites with a much lower concentration of nickel than normal. However can contain more cobalt and carbon than normal.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest104.desc: Generic mostly pure uranium found on the upper layer of uranothorium geodes.
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest105.desc: Also called uraninite is a uranium-rich mineral. May also contain thorium and other rare-earth elements
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest106.desc: A potassium uranium vanadate mineral. Can contain traces of calcium, barium, magnesium, iron, and sodium
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest107.desc: A very rare uranium mineral with a deep yellow color due to the high uranium concentration
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest108.desc: Also known as chalcolite, this is a vibrantly green copper uranyl phosphate crystal found in granites
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest109.desc: A hydrated calcium uranyl phosphate crystal with a yellow-green apperance due to the fluorescent phosphate mineral
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest11.descr: Ancient iron from the Precambrian 3.7 billion years ago, surviving all this time to be turned into a spring for your pens
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest110.desc: A rare neosilicate of thorium. Commonly associated with zircon, monazite, gadolinite, fergusonite, uraninite, yttrialite, and pyrochlore
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest111.desc: A ver rare uranium bearing form of thorite ore
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest112.desc: A rare thorium oxide that can include traces of uranium, lanthanum, cerium, praseodynium and neodymium
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest113.desc: Generic mostly pure tin found on the upper layer of tin geodes.
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest114.desc: A tin oxide mineral that forms as opaque thin crystals that can sometimes appear translucent.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest115.desc: A sulfide of copper, iron and tin. Contains traces of germanium and sometimes found along side wolframite
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest116.desc: A sulfosalt containing tin, lead, antimony, and iron
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest117.desc: A complex sulfide mineral related to cylindrite. A hydrothermal silver-tin deposit
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest118.desc: A rare silver tin sulfide mineral with trace amounts of fermanium and tellurium
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest119.desc: A sulfide mineral of tin and lead found in hydrothermal vents
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest12.descr: Formed by iron bacteria &b(Thiobacillus Ferrooxidans and Thiobacillus Thiooxidans)&r eating nutrients from ground water and surface flows, pooping out oxidized iron over time forming this ore. &cTho we arn't near a swamp it's very strange that it ended up here....
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest120.desc: A super rare uranium tin mineral primarily found in granite
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest121.desc: A tectosilicate that forms in igneous rock. While tin is not primarily found in it, it is associated with some tin ores
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest122.desc: Generic mostly pure sulfur and niter found on the upper layer of Migmamite geodes.
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
&bNote: This geode contains a very random mix of ores used in many many lines and thus do not have consistent processing
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest122.titl: Raw Niter, Sulfur, and other Minerals
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest123.desc: A natural mineral source of potassium nitrate. Can be used to make gunpowder, preserve meat, and prevent bacteria growth
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest124.desc: A salt of sodium and boron. Often used in metallurgy as flux, component of glass, pottery glazes, and a pharmaceutic alkalizer
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest125.desc: A highly compressed hunk of limestone. Used as pigment, soil conditioner, cement, and as a reagent in flue-gas desulfurization
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest126.desc: Solidifed volcanic flow highly concentrated in sulfur. Being from a volcanic source it contains a slurry of trace elements
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest127.desc: While not too useful mechanically processed, it seems prone to transmutation when reacted with mana into various dyes, could be an easy way to mass stock those
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest128.desc: An ancient piece of wood from a long gone species.. &cI wonder if I can bring it back if I don't crush it
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest129.desc: A white porous form of limestone made of calcite and the skeletons of billions of plankton that settled to the sea floor. Can be used in pottery glazing, decomposed into slaked lime, in agriculture to raise pH, and to confuse college students on a blackboard
&6Processing information not displayed as it splits too much
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest13.descr: A chunk fallen from the heavens. Not fantastic for iron ironically enough but contains trace amounts of rare metals. Will probably require more chemical mastery to tap into.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest130.desc: A trisodium hydrogendicarbonate dihydrite, primary source of baking soda for bread making
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest131.desc: Drops 64 ores total from a pool of 8 options, requires at least a terra steel pickaxe to mine
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest132.desc: Drops 16 ores total from a pool of 8 options, requires at least an elementium pickaxe to mine
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest133.desc: Drops 4 ores total from a pool of 8 options, requires at least a manasteel pickaxe to mine
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest134.desc: Drops 256 ores total from a pool of 8 options, requires at least an alfsteel pickaxe to mine
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest135.desc: Drops 64 tectonic ores, requires at least a bedrock breaking pickaxe to mine
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest136.desc: Blast them with heat and lye!
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest139.desc: So many ores?? How to keep track of everything?!
Fear not! &6I have it laid out here for you! Some key parts:&r
&dMetal Processing on the left details processing per major progression tier for ingots and powders
&bGem Processing on the right details processing per major progression tier for gemstones&r
&6Each ore listed below is grouped per major type as well as detailing all side products unlocked per tier
&aMining of the ores is detailed in the center locked behind pickaxe tiers
&6Also most of the descriptions are from wiki so if something is wrong yell at them not me
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest139.task: I really hope you read this
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest14.descr: Generic mostly pure copper found on the upper layer of copper geodes. &eThere seems to be quite a variety of organic life around these
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest140.desc: Some gemstones are more useful crushed to dust..
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest141.desc: By making a special polishing liquid, far more crystal can be recovered per crystal. 1 gram of diamonds is like 15 grams
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest142.desc: Reap the soils of the world
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest143.desc: Encased in thick rock layers of basalt these ores contain elements churned up from deep within the earth. Absolutely &evital&r for scaling up production as these ores yield products for &bagriculture, highly advanced alloys,&r and truly &bindustrial scale acid production&r
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest144.desc: Contrary to the ore name, you dont need to go to Germany for it.
&eGermanite&r will be an important ore to harvest for it's &agermanium&r content.
Germanium, especially in alloys has unique properties with how it interacts with light and makes it a &bcrucial element for building laboratory quality instruments&r
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest145.desc: Over millions of years mineral springs concentrated &alithium&r in the earth into ores pure enough to form crystals brimming with battery metal.
Of course this is only the start of the journey for it as processing it to a useable state is rather involved
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest146.desc: Oil Sand and Kerogen can be considered to be in that transition state between once being an alive thing and being pumped at the gas station.
While difficult to process the rich hydrocarbon soup will yield a huge amount of industrially relevant products
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest147.desc: Something must of gone catastrophically wrong here for there to be such a high abundance of bones and fossils
&cIt's almost as if it's hidden sins of some entity..&r Regardless it is rather useful
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest148.desc: A rather unusual deposit, the holes within the pumice-like-endstone have &atrapped gas&r within it requiring some liquid assisted bubbling to capture. &cThe air doesnt appear to be from here however&r and has some unusual properties to it.
There is also a surprising amount of fungi-like spores embeded in the stone
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest149.desc: It seems that in some parts of the world the ground entirely delaminates from the flake walls revealing a deep pit downwards. Outside of raw material abundance, there's probably fantastic data within the rocks to learn more about this world
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest15.descr: A copper-iron sulfide form of copper. This is the most abundant form of copper typically but the boulder ratios do not reflect reality.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest150.desc: Nuclear material decays via the ejection of a &bHelium-4&r nucleus, not very quickly mind you but over geological time you can get large deposits of it in porous rocks
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest151.desc: Rare earths are not actually very rare! The reason they are called rare is due to their relative concentration in the soil being somewhat low, thus requiring large volumes of earth to gather useable amounts.
The ores here are &babundant&r but do not let that fool you on yields as their processing with be intensive and difficult
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest152.desc: &cI can... hear something down there... it's so faint&r
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest153.desc: By injecting high temperature sodium hydroxide through some ores all impurities can be leached allowing for much better yields
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest154.desc: A select few ores have or once had life within them. Feeding and re-activating that life will grant rather unique uses as well as more yield
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest155.desc: Having trouble knowing what to look for? The &bimage&r below shows what boulders look like in-game and on minimaps!
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest16.descr: A copper carbonate used in ancient times as a green dye for makeup! (It's also quite toxic dont do that)
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest17.descr: The blue color is a result of weathering of copper forming layers of oxide onto the metal
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest18.descr: A copper antimony sulfosalt. Antimony is a rather important element for electronic industry so make sure to stock up on it
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest19.descr: A copper arsenic sulfosalt mineral, do not eat this, it wont be good
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest2.descri: This line of quests will guide you towards major key steps in increasing yields in metal-type processing
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest20.descr: A hydrous copper phyllosilicate, used by the greeks to solder gold together, sadly it's pretty bad as actual solder
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest21.descr: Yet another copper arsenic sulfosalt mineral, however this one also contains iron and zinc in its structure
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest22.descr: An intensly green copper cyclosilicate, can have some uses as an X-ray diffraction crystal
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest23.descr: Generic mostly pure gold and silver found on the upper layer of electrum geodes. &eAncient node of gold and silver taken over by a long dead ancient coral encasing itself around the node itself, spilling digestive acids around its corpse
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest23.title: Raw Gold and Silver
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest24.descr: Concentrated sediment found in areas where rivers fan out and deposite the wethered rock. &cStrange to see it in a solid ore however&r
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest25.descr: Due to gold being rather unreactive chemically it is very common to find pure elemental gold in nature
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest26.descr: A silver sulfide ore, not a true mineral due to the geometry of the bonds being unstable under most conditions but nonetheless is a source of silver
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest27.descr: A silver chloride crystal. Also takes the name cerargyrite and is named horn silver once the desert air weathers it away.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest28.descr: A sulfosalt with silver, copper, antimony and arsenic! Sometimes it demonstrates brilliant coloration, truly a useful and pretty mineral
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest29.descr: A silver sulfarsenide crystal, not particularly useful in any laser applications but does have a beautiful glimmer
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest30.descr: Much like native gold, electrum can form naturally due to golds willingness to chemically bond to silver, tho some copper can sneak in during formation
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest31.descr: A very rare form of natural electrum with significantly higher gold concentrations
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest32.descr: Generic mostly pure redstone found on the upper layer of mercury geodes. &eA tendril of obsidian coated in mercury wrapping around the boulder is seen
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest32.title: Raw Redstone and Mercury
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest33.descr: A mercury(II) sulfide crystal, most common source for raw elemental mercury, but here serves as a source of redstone as well
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest34.descr: Extremely similar to regular cinnabar except for it being a high temperature form resulting in a different crystal structure
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest35.descr: An extremely rare mercuty sulfide chloride, pretty chemically similar to cinnabar outside of the inclusion of chlorine in the structure
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest36.descr: The crushed up remains of cooled lava. While not particularily rich in anything it does contain a large variety of elements in it.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest37.descr: Used historically as a component of medication believed to treat nearly everything. Of course being mostly mercury the only thing it did cure was being alive
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest38.descr: Mercury is able to form in nature as a native metal resulting in some ores sweating out the liquid metal once excavated.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest39.descr: The mineral form of mercury(II) oxide, fairly rare mineral. Typically deposits itself in hydrothermal areas.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest4.descri: Quadruplicating your ores already! Feels nice ey?
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest40.descr: Volcanic glass! Or well I suppose it's more like glass powder in this state. Contrary to minecraft obsidian is rather fragile but can form blades sharper than most surgical scalples.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest41.descr: Generic mostly pure coal found on the upper layer of coal geodes.
&eMay contain some useful liquids early game as well
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
&bNote: Coal ores have additional processing chains outside of extracting coal
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest42.descr: The lowest carbon concentration coal and high in moisture, used almost exclusively as fuel but has a surprising amount of uses in agriculture and biological sciences
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest43.descr: Also called black coal is a coal containing bitumen, a sort of sticky black tar. Can be used in production of metallurgical coal (coking coal). Most common form of coal
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest44.descr: Cousin of bituminous coal, this one has a lower carbon content and is somewhat similar to lignite. Primarily used as fuel
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest45.descr: The highest grade of coal, ideal for production of metallurgical coal (coking coal)
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest46.descr: A form of bituminous coal, however, due to the formation conditions is often refered to as oil shale or boghead coal.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest47.descr: Another type of lignite, meaning it's quite bad as far as coals go. It does however more closely resemble the wood it comes from along with little pyrite inclusions giving it a rather unique shine
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest48.descr: A compacted patty of decaying organic matter that is surprisingly flammable. Able to retain a large amount of moisture and nutrients giving it interesting agricultural uses. Probably best to keep in this form and not process too much
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest49.descr: A big irregular carbon crystal made from layers of graphene. Has excellent uses in lubricants, electrodes, and that random piece of pencil "lead" stabbed into you as a child that is still with you.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest5.descri: Generic mostly pure iron found on the upper layer of iron geodes. &eExtruded from the inner world, boiling hot with magma and basalt
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest50.descr: Generic mostly pure diamond, lapis, emerald found on the upper layer of gemstone geodes. &eOnce believed to be ice frozen so cold it could never melt, this boulder of crystals glisens with the shards of ice surrounding it
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest50.title: Raw Gemstones
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest51.descr: A prised ore due to its inclusion of diamonds. Much like real life, these arn't as rare as one might think.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest52.descr: Less common source of diamonds but just as useful. Due to it containing a large amount of volcanic rock this ore can yield a decent amount of useful side products
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest53.descr: A mineral consisting of sulfate, sulfur, aluminum and chloride. Often found in limestone or calcite rock.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest54.descr: A semi-precious stone demonstrating a brilliantly blue hue. Often found with pyrite inclusions
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest55.descr: A cluster of similar crystals including primarily Emerald, Sapphire, and Ruby
&bNote: For Tier 1 processing and beyond the "random salvage" is the rest of the gemstones, only ruby gets listed
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest56.descr: A calcium fluoride mineral. Can have a range of color from green to purple along the crystal
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest57.descr: An unatural blob of chalcogenide group III and IV metals and metalloids
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest58.descr: A big ol' lump of salts. Wouldn't recommend licking this since some of them are toxic, but who am I to stop ya
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest59.descr: Generic mostly pure quartz and certus found on the upper layer of quartz geodes. &cWell thats curious, not sure how a meteor would get into here, seems to have technology within it as well
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest59.title: Raw Quartz
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest6.descri: A hydrated iron. By mass has less iron than a pure sample but could potentially be an easy source of hydroxide
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest60.descr: Double-terminated quartz crystals within dolomite. Contrary to the name this is not an actual diamond, but still very useful!
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest61.descr: A variety of chalcedony. This gemstone is forged within a volcano and other metamorphic rocks. &c... Where is the volcano? Why is this here..&r
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest62.descr: A crypyocystalline form of silica comprised of fine intergrowths of quartz.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest63.descr: Quartz with titanium in it?! While the amount isnt very high, it will be your first easy to access source of the metal
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest64.descr: A mixture of amethyst and citrine. The coloration is due to inclusions of iron with different oxydation states. It also looks like a delicious rock candy
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest65.descr: A rather pretty quartz variant that can be used to boost the production of polished rose quartz from create. Alternatively you can pull quartz out of like normal
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest66.descr: Effectively just a green quartz. A literal translation of the name means "scallion green-colored stone" from the Greeks
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest67.descr: A chunk of scifi crystal straight from the heavens! This will probably be very vital
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest68.descr: Generic mostly pure zinc found on the upper layer of zinc geodes. &eDesiccated arid ground erroding away to reveal a pillar of zinc pushed from deep within the ground
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest68.title: Raw Zinc
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest69.descr: A large lump of easy to refine zinc. Not a true ore as it used to be called Calamine in the past, but that doesn't stop it from being here
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest7.descri: Basically rust ore, fairly common flavor of iron ore
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest70.descr: A rather pretty ore sporting cubic formations of zinc suldife embeded within the rock
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest71.descr: Also known as zinc spar, a fairly commong way to source zinc. Tho it's probably too raw in this state to use it to help your flu symptoms
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest72.descr: A crystal primarily comprised of zinc with silicates. Often found along side lead
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest73.descr: A zinc-iron sulfide mineral. A structural polymorph of sphalerite, and thus the yields are somewhat similar
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest74.descr: Also known as a zinc bloom, this is a carbonate mineral containing large amounts of zinc
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest75.descr: A Zing silicate mineral that demonstrates strong fluorescence under shortwave uv light, which made it used in first generation fluorescent tube phosphors
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest76.descr: An oxide mineral of zinc and iron. Belongs to a subgroup containing spinel and magnetite
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest77.descr: Generic mostly pure aluminum found on the upper layer of bauxite geodes. &eThe acidic and aluminum rich soil acts as a strong antibacterial substrate, allowing for complex mycology to develop undisturbed
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest77.title: Raw Alumin(i)um
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest78.descr: Fun fact! In ancient times aluminum was more valuable than platinum due to the relative rarity of native aluminum. Of course with modern electrochemical processing methods aluminum has become one of the cheapest metals around. Bauxite being a primary ore for it.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest79.descr: A group of rock-forming aluminum tectosilicate minerals. Typically also contain sodium, calcium, potassium, or barium.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest8.descri: Can be naturally magnetic! Crucial for building your first polarizer
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest80.descr: A surprising amount of crystals are primarily aluminum and oxygen, and it seems that a grouping of them combined into one monstrous crystal
&bNote: For Tier 1 processing and beyond the "random salvage" is the rest of the gemstones, only ruby gets listed
&bNote: The yields show up as x22 to account for the %% being lower to be about x1/7
&bNote: The yields show up as x22 to account for the %% being lower to be about x1/7, &eNow outputs as blocks
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest81.descr: A rather handy form of aluminum ore. The molten form of cryolite is able to dissolve other aluminum oxides fairly readily making extraction more efficient.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest82.descr: A magnesium aluminum gemstone. Name crom the Latin word &ospinella&r basically meaning "spine"
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest83.descr: A hydrous phosphate copper-aluminum mineral, and contrary to the color, does not taste like a gogurt
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest84.descr: A lump of pulverized rock ideal for abrasive. There are many flavors of garnet including pyrope, almandine, spessartine, grossular, uvarovite, and andradite. Unfortunetly this slurry is ground very fine which would require significant chemical work to restore the gemstones.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest85.descr: A very rare form of aluminum typically, tho &cit seems to be rather abundant here for whatever reason
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest86.descr: Generic mostly pure lead found on the upper layer of lead geodes. &ePillars of calcite and bleached stones leaking diluted acids, lead leaching into pourous stone
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest86.title: Raw Lead
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest87.descr: A natural mineral of lead(II) sulfide. Tends to be accompanied by silver and acts as an important source of it
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest88.descr: A purer form of lead(II) sulfide. Typically found as galena ore, however, this form is far more pure and less contaminated by side products
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest89.descr: A lead chlorophosphate ore. Typically forms in clumps of crystals on basaltic rocks
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest9.descri: Don't be a fool this isnt gold. However it does contain quite a decent fraction of sulfur
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest90.descr: Known as lead carbonate or white lead ore. Forms elaborate long crystal structures
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest91.descr: Yet another lead sulfate mineral. Forms as a semi-transparent white crystal. Can sometimes be found in a matrix of limonite
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest92.descr: Yet another lead sulfate mineral. Forms as a semi-transparent white crystal. Can sometimes be found in a matrix of limonite
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest93.descr: Belongs to the apitate group of phosphates. A lead crystal containing large amounts of vanadium. The larger crystal forms of it resemble a delishious dulce de leche candy. Don't eat it tho
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest94.descr: A lead arsenate chloride mineral. Formed by the oxidation of galena and arsenopyrite. Looks like a lemon gummy
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest95.descr: Generic mostly pure nickel found on the upper layer of nickel geodes.
&dDeeper layers require better tools to fracture open
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest95.title: Raw Nickel
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest96.descr: A iron-nickel sulfide mineral. Often found in a 1:1 ratio of iron to nickel
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest97.descr: A green nickel ore found in pockets of serpentinized ultramafic rock.
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest98.descr: Chemically weathered rock often rick in nickel and other metals
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.quest99.descr: Similar to Garnierite, this is formed by lava hardening. This form of it is much more rich in sulfur and smells like rotten eggs
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.subtitle0: I am a dwarf and I'm digging a hole
ftbquests.chapter.ore_line.title: &aЛиния руд
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest1.descri: Помидоры используются в начале игры в качестве источника кислоты для создания тестов на кислотность, выращивайте их!
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest1.title: Это.. фрукт? овощ?
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest10.descr: Кожа! Хотя на ранних этапах её добыча несколько раздражает, она очень важна для получения множества предметов. Начинайте фармить.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest10.title: Куда мне девать эту говядину..
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest11.descr: Нить можно добыть многими способами, некоторые из которых полностью избегают взаимодействия с мобами. Она находится здесь только потому, что в верхнем ряду и так слишком много всего.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest11.title: Всё связано
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest12.descr: Блок шерсти. Вы уже знаете, что здесь нужно делать, запаситесь ножницами.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest12.title: Волк в... как мне это носить?
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest13.descr: Хотя их можно получить на нулевом тире, до первого они бесполезны. Наслаждайтесь своей ягодой.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest13.title: Раньше это был бамбук
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest14.descr: Хотя технически их можно добыть на нулевом тире, они не понадобятся до первого
&bРыболов&r (блок) может автоматизировать рыбалку, а &eАлхимический катализатор&r способен превращать одив вид рыбы в другой.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest14.title: Дельфиний мяч
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest15.descr: Пшеница! Вы её знаете, вы её любите. Если только у вас нет целиакии (это совсем не весело). В общем, я опьянел от всего этого &bэтанола&, который можно из неё получить.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest15.title: Собирать пшеницу и умирать от оспы
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest16.descr: Хотя он использется только в &bПервом тире&r для мода Botania, вероятность его выпадения довольно низкая, и для добычи требуется целая ферма. Впрочем, даже обычный картофель не будет лишним - содержащийся в нём &bкрахмал&r представляет немалую ценность для химии.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest16.title: Картофель со вкусом соланина
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest17.descr: Воск обладает фантастическими свойствами, в том числе водоотталкивающими и огнестойкими. В &dПервом тире&r он значительно облегчит создание некоторых преметов и понадобится в дальнейшем. Просто радуйтесь, что это пока не пчёлы из Forestry...
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest17.title: Мне нужно сделать отсылку на карате пацана?
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest18.descr: Хотя они и не используются повсеместно, они довольно важны для создания возобновляемого источника незерака, необходимого для поддержания супер-нагрева в горелках всполохов!
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest18.title: не та бородавка, что лечат у дерматолога
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest19.descr: Хотя основным применением этих животных пока является сдирание с них шкуры, мясо, которое они оставляют после себя, продолжает накапливаться! К счастью, вы можете извлечь из него белок, чтобы производить &eчернильные мешки&r для своего производства ручек, если, конечно, вы не построили огромную ферму спрутов!
Most proteins do work it's more that this one is already being generated anyways
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest19.title: Я предпочитаю жижкое мяса
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest2.descri: Капуста содержит природный индикатор pH, называемый антоцианином, который на ранних стадиях практически незаменим проведения химических анализов. Выращивайте капусту!
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest2.title: Большой зелёный шар
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest20.descr: Используется для приготовления первой партии уксусной закваски.
Одним из хороших источников бактерий являются гнилые помидоры.
В любом случае, даже в благоприятных условиях для её получения потребуется много попыток, и в большинстве случаев вы просто получите грязную чашку Петри.
Не волнуйтесь, просто промойте чашку в горячей воде, нанесите новый агар-агар и попробуйте снова... если чашка Петри осталась целой. Запаситесь парочкой...
К счастью, вам нужно изготовить лишь одну такую, что бы без труда начать массовое производство закваски.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest20.title: Мать уксуса, производство походящее на Сизифов труд™
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest3.descri: Окаменевшая древесина содержит древнюю генетическую информацию о давно исчезнувших видах деревьев. &cМожно ли из нее вырастить саженцы...
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest3.title: Древнее дерево?
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest4.descri: Обычно её можно получить только срубая траву ножом, однако из-за потребности в книгах на ранних этапах игры был разработан новый метод - переработка саженцев деревьев.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest4.title: Пучок веток
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest5.descri: Вы знаете, как её использовать, чтобы улучшить свой урожай
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest5.title: Скелетная пыль
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest6.descri: As it turns out Lignite coal acts as a slow release fertilizer and mild pesticide
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest6.title: I thought coal was bad?
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest7.descri: Выращивать её довольно просто, просто используйте костную муку.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest7.title: Черепашья еда
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest8.descri: Как морская трава, но повыше. Очень важна для многих производств, настоятельно рекомендуется автоматизировать добычу как можно скорее.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest8.title: Они диетические?
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest9.descri: Автоматизация на начальном этапе ужасно раздражает, но для ручек она абсолютно необходима.
&bЕсли от фермы спрутов вам хочется плакать, то на первом тире доступна химическая линия изготовления чернильных мешков.
ftbquests.chapter.organics.quest9.title: Хорошо сочетается с пастой
ftbquests.chapter.organics.title: &aОрганика
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest10.ti: I know how to make thing now!
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest11.de: I'm sure all the chemicals that went into this is great for my health
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest11.ti: This ingot makes me want blueberries
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest12.de: With enough stones to flip you can eventually simulate reality.. assuming you dont mess up a bit flip somewhere
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest13.de: I'm sure this quest makes server admins feel very safe
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest14.de: I lost a piece of my soul automating these but now the factory can really pick up pace
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest16.de: Agony and suffering is a mod by Vazkii
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest17.de: These alloys feel like wriggling insects in my hands, eugh
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest18.de: I should of put glue in these, they keep flying apart!
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest2.des: I'm not sure if this is better than a sword
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest3.des: Does.. does this mean my machines are alive...?
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest3.tit: A Create and Botania love child
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest5.des: Why are all of these instructions in swedish
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.quest9.des: Still not sure where the hand crank went into this thing
ftbquests.chapter.proficiency.title: &fProficiency (Мастерство)
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest1.de: Thats right! To make early game easier paper now takes bark instead of sugar cane.
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest10.d: Sulfur allows the rubber to undergo vulcanization, boosting yields significantly
This is the scaling tree for mana-imbued glucose crystal
This is the scaling tree for mana-imbued oobleck
Quenching the cellulose allows the sugars to re-organize into a beautiful blue sugar crystal
&7Note: A "Craft" is counted using the full bucket of Amorphous Cellulose
By cranking up the temperature and adding a tiny amount of hpa-4 a better recovery of sugar can be achieved. Now you may be asking &e"I thought this turned sugar to formic acid?"&r and normally that would be true, but this has mana in it, which means it's new and different and I said so
&6DSP&r, or disodium phosphate, can act as a thickening agent letting your mush get, well, mushier
This is the scaling tree for low voltage capacitors
Molybdenum Trioxide's useful electric properties allows you to use less polycrystalline silicon carbide per individual capacitor, allowing for more capacitors overall
Polycrystalline Silicon Carbide is a robust high durability high conductivity material, making it vital for electronics
This is the scaling tree for skystone encrusted boules
Ice is needed to rapidly cool molten skystone and allow for crystals to form on the silicon boule
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest11.d: Chuck some of that raw stuff into a furnace, cures it right up
Dry Ice, being colder than regular ice, allows the skystone to crystalize much more effectively, increasing yields
This is the scaling tree for samples of sulfuric acid &eand&r sulfur trioxide
&6Volcanic sulfur&r is the easiest raw source of &dsulfur trioxide&r, a main ingredient of sulfuric acid
&7Note: Outputs will account for the usage of a full volcanic sulfur as sulfur trioxide can still be sourced from impure dust at a lower rate
Vanadium Pentoxide acts as a catalytic agent for the conversion of sulfur dioxide to sulfur trioxide in the presence of oxygen, dramatically boosting yields
&b3 Buckets Per Volcanic Sulfur &7Assuming Crushing Wheel Processing
This is the scaling tree for amorphous cellulose
Melting down that &6munchdew mush&r in some acid will give some magical plant tar
&b1 Bucket of Amorphous Cellulose per craft
As it turns out your advances in paper production double up as a useful additional dissolving agent for magical plants... I suppose that's not much of a surprise
&b2 Buckets of Amorphous Cellulose per craft
With some chemical assistance from &69,10-Antraquinone&r much more pulp can be made from the same quantity of plant matter
By adding some &6starch&r to hydroangea mush it becomes a heat resistant low friction goop. Probably useful
By purifying the sulfur under a nitrogen atmosphere more sulfur (and other trace elements) can be pulled out of the ore
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest13.d: Crude plastic reinforcing allows for the same quantity of leather to yield a doubling on books
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest14.d: This is the scaling tree for stainless steel
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest15.d: Chromium is your standard entry point to cooking up some stainless steel. The other steel flavors don't scale. &eSomething to note, the scaling for stainless steel is to reduce trace element use per unit made and not necessarily for gaining material out of nothing.
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest16.d: With the addition of some rarer molybdenum the quantities of the other elements can be reduced rather dramatically
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest17.d: This is the scaling tree for ae2 processors
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest18.d: By pressing on the duds to a sheet of printed silicon processors can be made more efficiently
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest19.d: Simple stamped material gets the job done albeit rather inefficiently
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest2.de: This is the scaling tree for paper
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest20.d: This is the scaling tree for quartz glass
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest21.d: Unlike regular scale trees in quartz glass production the aim is to dramatically reduce useage of &3certus quartz&r by using better glasses. May even reduce the use of the glass itself
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest23.d: This is the scaling tree for rose quartz
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest23.t: Hey I could make an SU refrence
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest24.d: This is the scale tree for all pure daisy conversions
&eThe "scaling" with pure daisy conversion has to do with SPEED. More specifically using more constructed blocks to engage in the process that both take less time and yield more product
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest24.t: More Flower? No make it faster
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest25.d: Generic quartz can be painted red and if you squint your eyes kinda right it's rose-ish
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest26.d: Ok last quest was silly lets use an actual piece of rose quartz here
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest26.t: Wait which is the real rose quartz?
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest29.d: Normally this stuff is a replacement for animal products, however putting some leather in seems to make it significantly better so... dont tell anyone
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest3.de: Quite a bit more involved but the yield on paper is awesome!
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest30.d: Yet another doubling? This is absurd
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest31.d: As it turns out baking with borax will outright increase the quartz glass yields while preserving the chance to regain the certus dust, nice!
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest32.d: This is the scaling tree for charcoal
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest33.d: You know how this goes, chuck the wood like a wood chuck that can chuck wood into a furnace
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest34.d: Blast that wood in a coke oven! Not only will it crush into more charcoal per log, you will also collect &eRaw Wood Vinegar&r and &eWood Ash&r
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest34.t: It's like a furnace, but larger
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest35.d: This is the scaling tree for glazed terracottas
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest35.t: How is this different from bricks?
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest36.d: This is identical to vanilla, to the furnace you go!
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest37.d: By baking the terracotta with chalk you can much more efficiently glaze the surface. Dont ask where the 2nd block comes from, we will shoot you
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest38.d: Further removing impurities from the chalk lets it glaze with much more efficiency
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest39.d: This is the scaling tree for flux mixture
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest4.de: This is the scaling tree for books
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest40.d: This is the scaling tree for low temperature solder
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest41.d: This is the scaling tree for ceramic
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest41.t: So what if clay, but better?
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest42.d: More goes into the creation of a good quality ceramic but the &equartz dust&r is a focus due to it being the strengthening component
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest42.t: Imagine if sand could cut you
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest43.d: While being a &cnon-renewable&r ore Feldspar offers far greater yields as it is a very strong ceramic component
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest43.t: I hope you didnt process this lmao
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest44.d: This is the scaling tree for industrial grade coke
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest44.t: *coughing* Clean air is for comm *ghuhh* mmies
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest45.d: Packing together some &efuel&r and &elimestone&r is an easy way to get metallurically capable flux
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest46.d: Talc has this wonderful property of acting as a lubricant in metallurgic situations making forging easier and producing higher quality &e(quantity)&r flux
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest47.d: Borax is another wonderful addition to metallurgic flux as it is able to bind to oxides making slag management much easier
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest47.t: Do not confuse this for baking soda
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest48.d: Naturally with an alloy that releases vapors easily you want it to contain &elead&r. It also has &etin&r and &eantimony&r but those arn't as funny
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest49.d: Sprinkling in some &eborax&r helps drive away some oxides and gives you slightly more useable alloy.
What? You want it to yield more? Die
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest49.t: Could of sworn the quest above is also this..
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest5.de: Leather is such a pain early game to acquire! Thankfully some woven dried plants are able to bind paper together just as well
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest50.d: Industrial coke requires industrial quality! Only the best coals will do
&b4 Industrial Grade Coke per craft using &eAnthracite
&b2 Industrial Grade Coke per craft using &eBituminous
&b1 Industrial Grade Coke per craft using &eSubbituminous
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest51.d: By roasting the living hell out of coal with boiling hot sodium hydroxide solution you can pull impurities out both increasing yield and allowing a new type of coal, &eCannel Coal&r, to yield industrial grade coke
&b16 Industrial Grade Coke per craft using &eDe-mineralized Anthracite
&b8 Industrial Grade Coke per craft using &eDe-mineralized Bituminous
&b4 Industrial Grade Coke per craft using &eDe-mineralized Subbituminous
&b2 Industrial Grade Coke per craft using &eDe-mineralized Cannel Coal
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest52.d: This is the scaling tree for sterilized quartz glass
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest53.d: While not the most sophisticated cleaner, &evinegar&r will do enough of a job cleaning up the glass for use
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest54.d: With the addition of &e2-Phenoxyethanol&r a few more impurities are able to be removed and further reduce microbial life, giving more useable pieces
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest55.d: This is the scaling tree for petri dishes
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest56.d: A tier 1 berry for glass? Yeah just take it shut up
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest56.t: Surely you automated this by now
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest57.d: Exact same process, but with stronger glass you can get more
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest57.t: Glass, but made of strong crystals
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest58.d: This is the scaling tree for crude silicon boules
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest59.d: Proper Polycrystalline Silicon Boules require very precise pure processes but thankfully in this reality converting matter into energy in the explicit case of storage can be done with the most god awful impure silicon you can produce! Eh... dont think about it too hard
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest6.de: That being said about leather it does hold the books together a lot more firmly and thus less total raw material is needed
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest60.d: This is the scaling tree for polycrystalline silicon carbide
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest61.d: Due to the limited options for replacing gasses in recipes, this recipe has a high chance of failing due to oxgyen in the atmosphere
&c10%% chance of 1 &bPolycrystalline Silicon Carbide Boule per craft
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest62.d: Finally! After so much intensive infrastructure we have a nobel gas to cook these under
&b2 Polycrystalline Silicon Carbide Boules per craft
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest63.d: This is the scaling tree for slag gravel
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest64.d: While able to be found on &eIron Boulders&r you'll want to make your own for concrete production!
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest65.d: Rich slag is often produced in the &esteel making process&r and thus itself has more metal making it better for concrete production... somehow?
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest66.d: This is the scaling tree for lead acid cells
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest67.d: Producing cells like this efficiently requires some degree of &eelectrical infrastructure&r and sadly means your first cells will be &chorribly inefficient to produce&r
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest67.t: Pack it in and pray it doesnt explode
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest68.d: Now with electricity we can produce industrial quality sulfuric acid
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest69.d: With some very crude plastic acid leaking out is less of a concern, meaning the same volume of material lets you produce more cells

ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest78.d: This is the scaling tree for activated charcoal
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest79.d: By subjecting charcoal to hot acidic conditions we can make it more porous allowing it to act as a filter for many compounds
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest8.de: Most functional blocks that utilized andesite casings prior can take this to double the amount of machines you get per machine!
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest8.ti: You can hear the wrench inside
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest80.d: Using some spicier acid we can dramatically improve the yield of activated charcoal
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest81.d: This is the scaling tree for chemically inert wood
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest82.d: By forming a layer of carbon on wood with acid you can protect it against further chemical attack
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest83.d: This is the scaling tree for botania elemental runes
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest84.d: Runes are not cheap to make! Some require running flowers to failure
&b2 Fire Runes per craft using &a1 Endoflame mush&r
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest85.d: By refining the mush you can lower the per-unit use of it in crafting runes. You will still be eating the full cost of the other components however
&b2 Fire Runes per craft using &a1/8th of an Endoflame mush&r
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest86.d: This is the scaling tree for fire extinguishers
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest86.t: Wait we have to scale these?
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest87.d: Carbon Dioxide will be your first available fire retardant material. It is rather effective at handling electrical and flammable liquids.
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest88.d: Heptafluoropropane is a very powerful agent in smothering fires as it can do what CO2 can while also working very well against fires involving combustable solid materials
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest89.d: Each of these converts like its non-glimmering counterpart.
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest9.de: This is the scaling tree for cured rubber
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest90.d: All that sooty residue from making steel can be added to the mix to make ink far more efficiently!
However, it is way too runny to be used as-is, need something to congeal it somewhat...
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest90.t: On Thin Ic- Ink. Thin Ink.
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest91.d: This is the scaling tree for vinegar
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest92.d: Just blend it all together and something is bound to stick.
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest93.d: A culture of Acetobacter will let you make Vinegar starter.
Feed the vinegar starter to get more, then split some of it off and cook it to kill the bacteria inside and get vinegar, which you can then bottle up.
&cMaking the initial starter is not easy! Do not use it all up!
&7*(A craft means using the net gain of vinegar starter to make vinegar)
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest94.d: Using processed munchdew mush instead of sugar cubes (and adding a lot more yeast culture) gives way more vinegar starter per batch.
In fact, after removing the portion to cycle back in, you get 8 times as much!
&7*(A craft means using the net gain of vinegar starter to make vinegar)
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest95.d: This is the scaling tree for samples of chitin
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest96.d: Take some Mycelite produced by the Marimorphosis and toss it in an atomizer.
Simple, but the yield is not great.
&b15%% chance to get a Sample of Chitin
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest97.d: Mix together something that contains chitin, with sodium hydroxide and hydrochloric acid.
Most fungi can be used, although some shellfish will also work.
Heat a bucket of the resulting solution to get Impure Chitin Dust, which you can dissolve into Samples of Chitin.
&b8 Samples of Chitin per bucket of unbleached solution*
&7*Since the next steps involve varying ratios, a bucket of unbleached solution is used as the reference point.
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest98.d: Purify the chitin solution with some Potassium Permanganate and a bit more HCL.
This conversion is not efficient and a good chunk of the solution is irrecoverable, but overall yield is still improved.
&b12.8 Samples of Chitin per bucket of unbleached solution
ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest99.d: Add a bit of concentrated hydrogen peroxide while cleaning up the chitin solution to drastically increase the efficiency of the process.
&b32 Samples of Chitin per bucket of unbleached solution

ftbquests.chapter.scale_tree_i.quest99.t: When in doubt, add dangerous chemicals

ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest101.title: Hey
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest102.descri: Surprisingly useful to setup a supply of pufferfish to feed back into more botania assemblies.
The supply of ink sacs is also nothing to scoff at.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest102.title: The Chicken or the Cocoon?
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest103.descri: Fragile presses!? That's right, the processor presses will break after using them in the inscriber.
Make copies, you get more with better materials! You keep the original press when making a copy, so dedicate a few inscribers and automate production of copies.
The silicon press is a lot more sturdy and won't break with usage.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest103.title: They don't make these presses like they used to...
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest104.descri: You need &bmanganese&r to make certain specialized steel variants.
But the "simple" route needs specific machinery, which requires said steel variants.
&cThrough a chain of chemistry, purification of what I have, this will be a trial
&cThrough this trial, may the factory feed from it and &4flourish&r
This chemical chain is rather hellish... maybe &aChemistry and YOU!&r can help navigate this mess...
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest104.title: Suspiciously Foreboding
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest105.descri: To make more advanced machines, you will need more advanced blocks of steel.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest105.title: I got blocks of steel!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest106.descri: Stick some vacuum tubes on a backplane to make some simple circuits. Nothing too fancy, but will get the job done.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest106.title: One (1) ULV Circuit
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest107.descri: Place this under a mana pool, and it will transmute certain items thrown inside!
A good amount of transmutations are part of cyclical loops.
Example: Cod -> Salmon -> Tropical Fish -> &ePufferfish&r -> Cod
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest107.title: Full Mana Alchemist
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest108.descri: And as usual, write it all down.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest108.title: Basic Arcana Test Lexicons
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest109.descri: These thingabamobs can be reconfigured into a wide array of redstone logic components.
&cLooks like it could really come in handy later on...
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest109.title: Yup, that's redstone engineering, alright
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest11.descrip: With some chemical wizardry, we have punched many microscopic holes within an ingot of steel allowing it to absorb whatever liquids we want through capillary action
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest11.title: It doesn't live in a pineapple under the sea
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest110.descri: Make a bunch of these, and automate components made in the Engineer's Workbench!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest110.title: The Nauvis Experience
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest111.descri: It's time to get some &bCRUDE OIL&r.
We'll need lubricant for crafting and fuel for our engines.
However, we need some lubricant to get oil in the first place, so for now, just blend some creosote and steel grade coke, close enough.
When you're done, pipe that into a distillation tower to separate it into its various parts.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest111.title: No more hours of EBF time
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest112.descri: Under the bedrock, there's fluid reservoirs you can tap into.
Some are water, some are lava. And some are glorious black gold (oil).
To locate them, place down the &eSeismic Survey Tool&r and load it up with a buckshot cartridge.
Then interact with the tool. It will give you a map of nearby reservoirs. It is a 64x64 square, centered on the tool.
If you instead placed the tool ON a reservoir, you will get a survey reading with information about the reservoir.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest112.title: Digita, Orava \& Koni
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest113.descri: Before you start drilling, &6PREPARE ENOUGH FLUID STORAGE.
No, really. Look at the reservoir amount, and make at least half that in oil tanks or other fluid storage.
(You can use interfaces and fluid cells if you want, but a row of oil tank does look cool and industrial. Consult the manual on proper usage)
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest113.task_2:
I acknowledge that i need
immediate fluid storage
and promise to not complain
when i inevitably forget and
lose tons of oil.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest113.title: Full of OYUL
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest114.descri: Once you have everything in place, build a &bDerrick&r over the spot you want to drill.
Supply it with power, liquid concrete, water and fluid pipes.
&6Connect your fluid storage to it before it finishes drilling!
The moment it finishes drilling, fluid will start rushing out of the output.
I guess now would be a good moment to mention that it will NOT stop until the reservoir is at half capacity. Hope you brought enough storage, i told you!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest114.title: Strike the Earth! Or well, bedrock.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest115.descri: After the reservoir's pressure drops low enough that the derrick stops outputting, you can dismantle it.
A wellhead will be left behind, &6DO NOT BREAK IT.
Instead, build a &bPumpjack&r over it! It will slowly extract the rest of the reservoir.
Once a reservoir gets low enough, it will start replenishing up to a minimum level, meaning you can just leave the pumpjack there and keep extracting the liquid black gold.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest115.title: She pump on my j- ok it's not funny anymore.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest116.descri: The projector lets you choose a multiblock and show a hologram of the blocks in-world.
See exactly what you need to place down without having to look at the manual all the time.
You should read the manual though, you could find special uses for some things...
Still. Make the projector and save yourself some of the hassle.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest116.title: How do you build this multiblock again?
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest117.descri: Slag and Rich Slag can be processed into some very useful stuff!
With slag gravel, you can make concrete, or plant kelp on it to boost its growth. Yes, really.
Slag glass lets less light through and is used to insulate MV wires
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest117.title: Slag Is Not Trash!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest118.descri: After quenching the &eThermalily mush&r and crushing it with immense force this strange highly compacted volcanic glass is revealed within. It seems that attempting to &ecrush it further&r causes an unatural amount of powder to flake off while the shard mostly remains intact
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest118.title: Glowstick For The Vocaloid Concert
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest119.descri: Denaturing and neutralizing the &eMunchdew Mush&r leaves behind a very potent form of sugar. This sugar seems to dramatically affect the growth rate of &6microbial life&r. Time to get absurdly &ddrunk&r
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest119.title: A Jawbreaker You Will Actually Finish
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest12.descrip: Yes the amazing point in every pack where you must make coke and steel.
Do not despair quite yet as the crafting recipe for the ovens yields all 27 required bricks and features &bsignificantly reduced processing times!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest12.title: Oh god not this again
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest120.descri: Mixing in some starch with the &eHydrangea Mush&r gives this goopy stuff that is a bizarrely tough substance that hardens when pressured and liquifies when left alone. The mana present within the substance appears to aid in the solidification of &aglues and sealing materials&r as well, while itself barely being consumed
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest120.title: Da Goop
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest121.title: Elastic Anger
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest122.title: Narslimus Use
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest123.descri: After all your hard work you get the immense joy of... &bmaking springs&r
The coiler is also capable of flattening other bits of metal too, like &esandwiches&r
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest123.title: Will It Flatten?
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest124.descri: Your first real &bbattery&r. NiCd's are known for their high reliability maintaining high performance for a long time.
Now you may be some fun hating environmentalist saying cadmium is toxic or whatever but I can assure you &cthat does not matter here...
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest124.title: Very Powerful, Very Toxic
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest125.descri: Placing &bEnergy Cells&r on your network connecting to a wire will allow the cell to connect and function as &aenergy storage&r for your system
Energy cells also retain their charge when broken. Might be useful to stash a few for &6blackout prevention&r
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest125.title: Latent Energy
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest126.descri: Wirelessly &eaccessing your items&r wirelessly with wireless technology driven wirelessly by wirelessly powered wireless corporea-tech and wired-charging of your &ewireless terminal&r connected wirelessly to a &esecurity terminal&r which is wired to your system that now has wireless connections to your wireless terminal
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest126.title: Energy Bill Increaser
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest127.descri: By the power of your industry you have created a &dCorporea Tunneler&r
This object is able to shuttle items much longer distances than the regular corporea range using energy
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest127.title: Corpa-fi 5G
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest128.title: Nyooooom
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest129.title: I Believe I Can F- My Manaaaa
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest13.descrip: Much like the coke bricks, these also get batch crafted in 27 at a time. You will need industrial grade coke in order to run this furnace for the time being, better fuels will be available later
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest13.title: Oof Ouchy Hot Furnace
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest130.descri: Each &cRed Stringed&r block connects to a specific type of block, up to 8 blocks away and remotely interacts with it.
Note that this connection can go through other blocks, including other red stringed blocks.

Pretty useful for unique automation setups. &cContainers&r let you input/output items from further away. &cSpoofers&r let you shift a flower's area of effect, or perhaps concentrate a bunch of flowers' effects in one spot.
&aAll red stringed blocks are explained in the Lexica Botania!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest130.title: Superposition!? How does that even w- ooo pretty string
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest131.descri: Yes, That is &aCorrect&r, This is not a typo
Steam Engines are buffed to high hell, enjoy!
Oh and minor note, they are used to produce &bAir Runes&r so get to it buddy
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest131.title: 4 Million SU?!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest133.descri: Cordite Line - Future Ozy gun implementation
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest133.title: Cording my ite
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest134.descri: Entangled blocks can be connected to any complex block, and will behave like it's that block.
&eThere is no range limit. Go nuts.
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest134.title: This is where the shenanigans truly begin
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest135.title: Blue Chips and Limb Ripping Disasters
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest136.title: BONK! (But louder)
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest137.title: Abnormally Short
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest138.descri: &bMana Blasters&r are able to be crafted with a lens of your choice. The blast from the gun will inheret the properties of the lens and also works with combined lenses
Be careful about the &centropic lens&r ok?..
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest138.title: For My Neutral Special, GUN!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest139.descri: Lenses can now be cycled through &6all versions&r in an alchemy catalyst, entirely removing the gating they normally have, go nuts!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest139.title: Botanical Optometrist
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest14.descrip: Sadly the generic coal and lower quality coals do not produce sufficiently useful coke needed for steel production. As a result better coals are needed
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest14.title: No not that kind of coke!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest140.descri: Similar to lenses, the &bBand of Mana&r can be cycled with the alchemy catalyst. The available selection is &cslightly more restricted&r but includes some bands that would be &dtier-skips&r classically
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest140.title: Blinged Out
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest141.descri: With the &ealchemy catalyst&r all of that spare fish laying around can be converted to puffer fish, dramatically aiding in production of &bsemi-organic substrate&r
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest141.title: Become Poison Ball
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest15.descrip: The &econglomerate and dense conglomerate&r layer of ore can actually be harvested via explosion. This will actually be required for progression as the &bmanasteel&r pickaxe needed requires industrial coke quality coals to produce the steel
&dOther methods exist, but won't be stated in the quest book
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest15.title: 2,4,6-Trinitrotoluene
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest16.descrip: The backbone for any respectable factory. I crave the strength and certainty of steel
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest16.title: Symbol of Industry
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest17.descrip: The process of blasting organic material results in even more organic material! Who knew... Gonna have to clean this up to use it
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest17.title: Hydrocarbon Soup?
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest18.descrip: A hyper absorbant polymer able to hold onto multiple times its own mass worth of water, and possibly other polar liquids
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest18.title: Crime Scene Cleaning Solutions!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest19.descrip: This uhm.. Techy crafter uh... wait why is stuff floating there's no magnets in this
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest19.title: Technologmomically Crafting
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest2.descript: Svenska: Sätt in del 17a i stångsegment 1,2 och 5 för att rikta in segmenten för steg åttiotvå
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest2.title: &dSome Assembly Required
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest20.descrip: Drop some absorbant powder into the pool, it drinks it right up
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest20.title: I know it's a powder... don't
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest21.descrip: A binding agent to etch and act as glue for runic components
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest21.title: Somehow not sticky!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest22.descrip: This may look like a vanilla wafer, but it is mostly rock and metal, please don't put it in your mouth
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest22.title: NOT EDIBLE
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest23.descrip: Yippie we can finally make runes!
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest23.title: Keep an eye on the fire one...
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest24.descrip: A sturdy frame to channel totally technological energies and improve the structural stability of semi alive rock
ftbquests.chapter.tier_1.quest24.title: Tic-Tac-Toe
